technology: 1, There were no technical difficulties experienced by the participant.
cur_neg_affect: 1, The participant did not express any negative affect about the pandemic in the present.
past_neg_affect: 2, The participant expressed a small amount of negative affect when recalling the past, but it was not significant.
communal_orientation: 4, The participant engaged in conversation and asked questions, but did not give affirmations or seem entirely engaged.
engagement: 5, The participant was engaged in the conversation and tried to keep it going.
defensiveness: 1, The participant was not at all defensive in justifying their beliefs/perspective.
questions: "Would love to hear about what it was like for you?" [0:04:37]
"What was kind of going through your mind when vaccines rolled out?" [0:08:54]
"What pushed you to eventually get the vaccine?" [0:10:15]
"How do you feel about it now that you've gotten it?" [0:11:34]
"Did you have any reservations about the booster?" [0:12:00]
"Do you live by yourself or are you around other people when you had it?" [0:12:24]
vaccine_importance: 6, The participant believes that vaccines are important, as he got the vaccine and booster.
booster_importance: 6, The participant believes that boosters are important, as he got the vaccine and booster.
cognitive_complexity: 4, The participant demonstrated a moderate amount of cognitive complexity by considering different perspectives and analyzing the situation.
general_notes: The participant was very polite and engaged in the conversation. He was open to sharing his experiences and perspectives.
